Let me know how you go? Thanks and speak soon,

To: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
Subject: RE: ECM Charity Dinner - MS Research Australia

Hi Heath,

Thanks so much looks great! Nice work with the surfboard!
Have sent it to UBS for final approval.

One change on the page:
· Step 3
Enter your guests details
You can add guest names/dietary requirements at a later stage by emailing them to kgtms@msra.org.au <mailto:kgtms@msra.org.au> by the RSVP date. Please change the email to lyndall.evans@ubs.com <mailto:lyndall.evans@ubs.com>
Also I got the receipt confirmation email when I selected the PayPal option and didn’t even log into a PayPal account – is this just part of the test? Or will be people receive the receipt confirmation before finalising payment?
On the receipt confirmation email, are you able to add “This is an input tax credit event. GST is not applicable.” to the bottom, under “Donations of $2 or more are tax deductable”?

Do I need a coupon to try the credit card option?

Thanks,
Sam

<image001.jpg> <http://www.msra.org.au/>

Hi Heath,

With the ticketing page – happy to have the same style as the Secret Garden event, obviously with updated images and content as per the front event page.
The number of tickets that can be purchased is 10 as the maximum.

With the thank you page – please put the enquiries contact as Lyndall Evans - lyndall.evans@ubs.com <mailto:lyndall.evans@ubs.com> or Desk: (02) 9324-3459 <tel:(02)%209324-3459> or Mobile: 0414-909-983 <tel:0414-909-983>.

The confirmation email (I haven’t seen one of those) – as long as it’s up to date with this event’s relevant content that will be fine.

Any questions, let me know!

Have a great weekend!

Kind regards,
Sam

Sure, is it option to include the image in the ‘body’ of the page and use a generic ocean/wave image as the hero image across the top? The shape of the image is not ideal to use as the hero and it’s not great to put the event details on over the top of it, if that makes sense?

Regarding the ticketing/form, that’s something we do for you. If you send through the fields that you require, confirmation messages etc that would be great. You can copy and paste the current ones and then make the amendments.

Thanks and speak soon,

Sent: Wednesday, 19 September 2018 2:10 PM
To: Samantha Rosenfels <srosenfels@msra.org.au <mailto:srosenfels@msra.org.au>>
Subject: RE: ECM Charity Dinner - MS Research Australia

Samantha

For the website….. I am a bit short of more details right now, but thought we get the process underway as we would like to start selling tickets ASAP.

Firstly – UBS logo attached

Event name: 21st Annual ECM Charity Dinner
Host: UBS
Blurb: TO COME

Date: 6.30pm / Wednesday 21 November 2018

Venue:
Watermans Room at 12-Micron <>
Private Entrance off Watermans Quay,
North side of Tower one
Tower 1, Level 2, 100 Barangaroo Avenue
Barangaroo NSW 2000

PARKING:
There is a secure parking on King St Wharf, please see the link below:
https://www.secureparking.com.au/en-au/car-parks/australia/new-south-wales/sydney/king-street-wharf/king-street-wharf-car-park <https://www.secureparking.com.au/en-au/car-parks/australia/new-south-wales/sydney/king-street-wharf/king-street-wharf-car-park>

CONTACT:
Any questions at all, please contact: Lyndall on lyndall.evans@ubs.com <mailto:lyndall.evans@ubs.com> or Desk: (02)9324-3459 <tel:(02)9324-3459> or Mobile: 0414-909-983 <tel:0414-909-983>








From: Samantha Rosenfels [mailto:srosenfels@msra.org.au <mailto:srosenfels@msra.org.au>]
Sent: Monday, 17 September 2018 7:46 PM
To: Evans, Lyndall-CCS+
Subject: RE: ECM Charity Dinner - MS Research Australia

Hi Lyndall,

Great, well the site is customised so we can add whichever details you need.

My suggestion would be like the event I linked you below. So we would need all the details from your invitation and a blurb about the event. We like to add parking/transport details too but that’s optional.
Then the form for those buying tickets can also be customised. Currently we have first name, last name, dietary requirements, then it goes to a page for the number of tickets (here you can add the people’s names if you are buying a table), then it goes to details eg address, phone number, company. Then the last page is the payment method, which a credit card or PayPal can be used.

Do you have a design or theme? Or Logo? We can add that too across as a banner. The dimensions for the banner are:

1. Preview banner 741 x 500, please see examples here: https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/upcoming-events/ <https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/upcoming-events/>
2. Background banner on events page 2400 x 814, please see example here: https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/kiss-goodbye-ms-secret-garden/ <https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/kiss-goodbye-ms-secret-garden/>

Yes we can send you the exported document from the registrations each week leading up to the event, and more frequently as we get closer to the date.

Any further questions, please let me know.

Kind regards,
Sam J

<image001.jpg> <http://www.msra.org.au/>

Development and Events Coordinator

Samantha

This is great, what do you need from us to create the website ?? Much better ideas the fee was quite a lot on the external company. I assume I will be able to get all the data from ticket sales though so I know who is coming and paid?

With regard to payment/invoicing – that's fine; Hopefully we won't need to take money from the ticket sales, but if that is the case, I will organise an invoice.

Lyndall

From: Samantha Rosenfels [mailto:srosenfels@msra.org.au <mailto:srosenfels@msra.org.au>]
Sent: Monday, 17 September 2018 3:05 PM
To: Evans, Lyndall-CCS+
Subject: RE: ECM Charity Dinner - MS Research Australia

Hi Lyndall,

Lovely to speak with you.

I will let you know how I go with Camille and get back to you on the MCs.

In regards to the ticketing, I just spoke with our Senior Campaign Coordinator, who said if you don’t want to use an external ticketing site, we can do ticketing through our website, this way the only fee is that of a credit card surcharge.

We can create an event on the website like so - https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/kiss-goodbye-ms-secret-garden/ <https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/kiss-goodbye-ms-secret-garden/>

Let me know your thoughts?

Otherwise the bank details are as follows:

Account Name: Kiss Goodbye to MS
Bank: National Australia Bank
BSB: 082 057
Account #: 39 277 9892
Reference: UBS Event

I double checked with our accounts team, once funds come to us, the money cannot pay for the event costs without an invoice, e.g. helping hand will have to invoice us directly. So if the ticket sales are to cover some costs, the company will have to invoice us, MS Research Australia.

Any questions, please let me know.

Kind regards,
Sam

Thank you
Lyndall

From: Samantha Rosenfels [mailto:srosenfels@msra.org.au <mailto:srosenfels@msra.org.au>]
Sent: Thursday, 13 September 2018 3:58 PM
To: Evans, Lyndall-CCS+
Cc: Matthew Miles
Subject: RE: ECM Charity Dinner - MS Research Australia

Hi Lyndall,

Here is the list that I have received regarding Sydney based comedians:

<image009.jpg>
Andy Saunders $3,000 + GST travels from Sydney
Comedian
Comedian Andy Saunders believes the best way to make the world a better place is through laughter.
With an extraordinary ability to use humour to break down barriers and stereotypes as well as provoke thought, he is a talented MC and entertainer who will grab your audience's attention from the moment he walks onto the stage.
Bio: http://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/andy-saunders/ <http://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/andy-saunders/>
<image010.jpg>
Darren Carr $4,000 + GST travels from Sydney
Australia's leading, multi-award winning Ventriloquist
Darren Carr is recognised as Australia's Number One Stand Up Ventriloquist. He and his cast of crazy characters deliver professional and hilariously entertaining performances at corporate events, special events, clubs, theatres in Australia and worldwide.
Bio: http://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/darren-carr/ <http://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/darren-carr/>
Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lziwgdhC3vA <http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lziwgdhC3vA>
<image011.jpg>
Paul Martell $4,000 + GST travels from Sydney
One of Australia's leading and most successful corporate comedy entertainers and EMCEE's
Paul Martell has been voted an unprecedented 24 times "Comedian of the Year' by his peers and is one of Australia's most successful corporate comedy entertainers and MCs. A multi-talented performer, He remains in constant demand and is still one of the busiest comedians in the business due to his ability to continually ‘re-invent’ himself, stay fresh, non-offensive and current.
Bio: http://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/paul-martell/ <http://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/paul-martell/>

Tommy Dean $5,700 + GST travels from Sydney
Uniquely observant stand-up comic
Tommy Dean is an American comedian with a unique understanding of Australia, its audiences and above all, what makes us laugh.
Bio: http://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/tommy-dean/ <http://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/tommy-dean/>
Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rvlzT8DdXkg&feature=youtu.be <http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rvlzT8DdXkg&feature=youtu.be>

Mikey Robins $6,700 + GST travels from Sydney
Quick-witted MC, facilitator and stand-up comedian
Mikey Robins is one of Australia's best loved, most intelligent, most hilarious entertainers. His high profile career in radio and TV has made him one of the most recognisable faces and voices in Australian entertainment history.
Bio: http://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/mikey-robins/ <http://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/mikey-robins/>
<image014.jpg>
Gen Fricker $6,500 + GST travels from Sydney
Radio Broadcaster & Comedian
Gen Fricker is a hilarious Australia comedian and successful broadcaster on Triple J. Recognised for her sardonic humour, she is one of Australia's funniest stars on the national comedy circuit, delivering hilarious anecdotes and nonsense songs with a butter- wouldn't-melt-in-her-mouth smile.
Bio: https://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/gen-fricker/ <https://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/gen-fricker/>

Merrick Watts $10,000 + GST travels from Sydney
Comedian, broadcaster, actor, writer
Merrick Watts is one of Australia's best loved comedic personalities. Originally from Melbourne, he started his career doing stand up at local pubs before becoming an acclaimed radio host and television presenter.
Bio: http://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/merrick-watts/ <http://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/merrick-watts/>

Carl Barron $12,000 + GST travels from Sydney

Carl Barron is one of the country's most loved stand up comics and one of very few on the live scene to receive such enormous kudos.
Bio: http://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/corporate-comedy-speakers/carl-barron/ <http://www.celebrityspeakers.com.au/corporate-comedy-speakers/carl-barron/>

Let me know if any are of interest?

Yes we have a nice postcard on the Kiss Goodbye to MS campaign and how they can get involved or a flyer on more of the research we fund. I’d say the postcard would be more appropriate for a social event.

We will contact a few suppliers re items for goodie bags. What is the audience? ?

From: Samantha Rosenfels [mailto:srosenfels@msra.org.au <mailto:srosenfels@msra.org.au>]
Sent: Friday, 10 August 2018 3:53 PM
To: Evans, Lyndall-CCS+
Subject: RE: ECM Charity Dinner - MS Research Australia

Hi Lyndall,

Not a problem I will update the team.

I have aimed for a comedian, the agency is putting their feelers out for someone to do it for free or discounted so will see what they come back with.

In regards to the auction items, we usually get in a volunteer to search for companies and contact them for prizes etc. We are currently doing that at the moment for our fundraising event in October, so I will see if we can try get a few more items to share with you.

The other idea, is to use an auction service, such as Helping Hand (which we will be using for a few extra prizes) they provide prizes such as holidays and good to be added to your live & silent auction – “All of our items are supplied on a sell or return basis, the only way we take anything is if and when an item sells. All of our items have a set cost price so you know, up front, what we retain on each sold item, anything above that price is a donation back to you. We set the reserve, or minimum bid, on all of our items to cover not only our cost, but also a donation component. That means that if every item sells at the lowest bid, there is always a donation amount.”

Valerie is our contact and is very helpful!
